meanings.definition: To make something more difficult or confusing.
meanings.sent1: Trying to add too many toppings can complicate making a pizza.
meanings.sent2: Not following the recipe exactly can complicate baking a cake.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to juggle three balls while riding a unicycle only served to complicate things further.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected rain shower complicated our plans for a picnic in the park.
meanings.sent5: The maze of hallways in the old castle was designed to complicate intruders' progress.

meanings.definition: To involve or entangle in difficulties or complications.
meanings.sent1: Forgetting to bring a map can complicate a hiking trip.
meanings.sent2: Mixing up the meeting times can complicate scheduling appointments.
meanings.sent3: The magician's attempt to pull a rabbit out of a hat only served to complicate his magic trick.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected arrival of guests complicated the host's dinner plans.
meanings.sent5: The intricate plot of the mystery novel was designed to complicate the reader's understanding.
